text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Zvečan | official_name = | settlement_type = Town and municipality | other_name = | image_skyline = Zvecan2.jpg | imagesize = 250px | image_caption = Panorama of Zvečan | image_seal = | image_map = File:Municipalities of Kosovo Zvečan.svg | mapsize = | map_caption = Location of the municipality of Zvečan within Kosovo | pushpin_map = | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map_caption = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Kosovo | subdivision_type1 = District | subdivision_name1 = District of Mitrovica | subdivision_type2 = Settlements | subdivision_name2 = 36 | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Ilir Peci | leader_party = PDK | established_date = | area_total_km2 = 122 | area_land_km2 = | area_metro_sq_mi = | population_as_of = 2015 | population_footnotes = | population_notes = | population_total = 16,650 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_density_urban_sq_mi = | timezone = CET | utc_offset = +1 | timezone_DST = CEST | utc_offset_DST = +2 | coordinates = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 461 | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 38227 | area_code = +381(0)28 | blank_name = Car plates | blank_info = 02 | blank1_name = Climate | blank1_info = Cfb | website = }} Zvečan is a town in north of Kosovo, near Kosovska Mitrovica. , about 16,600 people lived there. The town was first mentioned at the time of border disputes between Serbia and the Byzantine Empire between 1091 and 1094. ==References== Category:Towns in Serbia
